p: Tocopherols constitute members of the vitamin E group, essential dietary components in mammals, and are associated with a decreased risk of many diseases [ 29]. Their biosynthesis is potentially derivable from the oxidation of phenolic compounds to quinones, and isoprenoid side-chain added (four isoprene units) [ 18]. The terpenoid quinone ( 7) identified in the genus Cedrela is shown in Table 3.
